page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF THE BLOCK
page.content: The block is situated on {high ground} between 600'-1100'skirted by the villages of Cragg Vale,Hubberton Green,Mill Bank and Soyland.The highest point lies to the north.The ground initially falls gradually in all directions and consists of reasonably{flat fields}and some marsh.To the west this gives way to a very steep wooded area.The slopes to the south-east fall more steeply after the plateau area.The area is drained by{two tributaries}-Old Eli Clough,originating in Flint's Reservoir(now dried up),which falls gradually through Cotton Stones and below the small village of Mill Bank,and secondly Nether Ends Beck both leading to the west flowingRiver Ryburn.The Elphin BrooK forms a boundary in the north-west
